sentences: Olen teinud palju reisi üle maailma.
context: The word 'reisi' has two main meanings in Estonian. First, it is the genitive, partitive, or illative singular form of 'reis', meaning 'trip' or 'journey'. Second, it can be the partitive plural form of 'reis', referring to 'thighs'. Based on context, it most commonly means 'trip' or 'journey'. In maritime contexts, it may also refer to a passenger ship or liner according to some definitions.
